channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Broken Fence Gate, 10th September
item.description:
This gate was first damaged (at least a month)and then completely broken in the last week or so. It is a safety hazard as it is simply on the pavement so elderly or mobility impaired people who may not concentrate in the evening could slip and fall.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): College Close, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The support straps for the young tree on the grass verge has been cut, giving the tree no support. It is badly listing and needs to be restrapped., 10th September
item.description:
The young tree on the grass verge outside our house needs to be supported. The supporting straps have been cut or broken and need repairing as the tree is now bending badly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Merlin Grove, Eden Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flags, 10th September
item.description:
Flags have appeared along the road. These are intimidating and positioned next to a multicultural primary school. This is vandalism and racism and we would like them removed. Children at the school are anxious and families feel intimidated.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Footscray Road, New Eltham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lots of waste, 10th September
item.description:

item.title: Roadworks on bridge, 10th September
item.description:
Roadworks on this rail bridge have appeared. nothing on bromleys roadworks website to say they are there and no end date. please sort. the timing of this really bad as this week the road outside orpington station is restricted yet again due to thames water digging up the road again so this makes both the local roads passing over and under the railway restricted causing chaos as usual
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crofton Lane, Poverest, London

item.title: Bins and dog faces, disgusting smell, 10th September
item.description:
Bins left outside at all time in awkward positions and in bad state. Disgusting state of property with dog living there pooing and peeing with excrements on walking public pavement. Disgusting smell coming from the property RSPCA should also be involved

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chatterton Road, Southborough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Repeated speeding & pedestrian danger on Quebec Way, 10th September
item.description:
I am writing to raise serious concerns about the safety of Quebec Way. As a residential street, it has increasingly become a leading to an alarming rise in speeding. Without any traffic calming measures in place, drivers frequently accelerate dangerously, posing a significant risk to pedestrians, cyclists, and local residents, including children (there is a nursery and school in the area). This reckless behavior is not only distressing for those living here but also creates an unacceptable hazard. Please take immediate action to prevent potential accidents or injuries by implementing traffic calming solutions, such as speed bumps, chicanes, or signage, before it’s too late. Ensuring the safety of our community should be a top priority, and we hope to see this issue addressed promptly.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Quebec Way, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet
